title: Upgrade OO Workflow Designer
content:
This topic contains the instructions to upgrade an OO Workflow Designer on Windows and Linux environments.

Plan

Before you start the upgrade process, make sure you meet the System requirements.

Prerequisite tasks

Review flow statuses

Cancel or finish all paused or running flows and disable existing schedules before you apply the upgrade. If there are flows running or paused when you perform the upgrade, it won't be possible to resume them. Their status will appear “Canceled” and the duration will be “0 seconds.”

Stop the OO Workflow Designer service

It's recommended to stop the OO Workflow Designer service.

  • To stop the OO Workflow Designer service in Windows: Navigate to Windows>Task Manager>Services. Right-click to select an OO Workflow Designer, and then select Stop.
  • To stop the OO Workflow Designer service in Linux: Navigate to <Install Location>/<oo Workflow Designer>/bin. Open the terminal and type the command: ./<oo Workflow Designer> stop
Make sure to close the OO Workflow Designer's browser session.

Steps to upgrade when OO Workflow Designer database uses Windows Authentication towards an SQL Server

To upgrade an OO Workflow Designer that uses Windows authentication with the Microsoft SQL Server database, perform the following steps:

  1. Copy the upgrade package to the root of the OO Workflow Designer install folder.
  2. Unpack the upgrade package at the root of the OO Workflow Designer install folder.
  3. Download sqljdbc_auth.dll for the 11.2.3 JDBC driver and copy it to the upgrade/<latest Designer version>/bin folder.

During the upgrade process, if you also have an IdM Service installed, the settings for Windows authentication on the IdM Service configuration may be reverted. To continue using Windows authentication on the IdM service, perform the following steps:

  1. Before the upgrade, back up and save the applicationContext.properties file from <designer>/tomcat/webapps/idm-service/WEB-INF/spring/ folder.
  2. During the upgrade, use the option –n or --norestart to not start OO Workflow Designer after the upgrade.
  3. After the upgrade, reconfigure the files following these steps: 
    1. Start OO Workflow Designer to populate the idm-service folder under the <designer>/tomcat/webapps folder. The startup may fail due to the wrong IdM settings.
    2. Stop Workflow Designer.
    3. Check the applicationContext.properties file from <designer>/tomcat/webapps/idm-service/WEB-INF/spring to check if the username and jdbc url parameters are valid for Windows authentication. In case the file has reverted to SQL authentication, replace it with the backed-up file.
  4. When upgrading from an OO Workflow Designer version based on Java 8, replace the sqljdbc_auth.dll from the <designer>/bin folder with the dll from the JDBC driver version 11.2.3.
  5. Start OO Workflow Designer.

Download OO Workflow Designer upgrade package

  1. Download and extract the upgrade package (upgrader-designer-<latest_version>.zip) on your local file system.
    • Contact your administrator for the upgrade package, or
    • Download the upgrade package from the product user interface. For product-specific details, see the related topics below.
  2. Next, verify the integrity of the upgrade packages.

Verify the integrity of the OO upgrade packages

To verify the integrity of the upgrade zip and the embedded digital signature certificates:

  1. Download the latest JDK from the Oracle site.  

  2. Install it in a suitable location on your local file system and locate your jarsigner utility under: <JDK_INSTALLATION>/bin

  3. Run the following command from the command line:

    jarsigner -verify -keystore 
<oo_installation>/designer/var/security/internal.truststore
-strict -verbose -certs <zip_file>

    where <zip_file> is the following zip file:

    • upgrader-designer-<version>.zip
  4. The output of the command might have the following messages:
    • jar verified - The upgrade package file is secure.
    • jar is unsigned - The upgrade package file isn't secure.
      Additionally, all JAR file entries listed in the output must have the "smk" label.

Extract the upgrade packages

  1. Extract the upgrade zip file onto your local file system.
  2. Navigate to the extracted directory and then copy the upgrade directory into the main component installation directory.
    The upgrade package will work only if the upgrade directory is under the main installation directory. For example, if OO Workflow Designer was installed in the default directory, then it must be under <Installation>\Operations Orchestration Designer, at the same level as the component.

Upgrade procedure

Environment Privileges required
Windows administrator
Linux root user

Upgrading to the latest version using a command line script. The relevant scripts are available in the extracted directory at <installation>\upgrade\<new-version>\bin.

The scripts are: 

  • apply-upgrade(.bat)–for upgrading to the latest version
  • rollback(.bat)–for rolling back to the earlier version
  • generate-sql(.bat)–if your company doesn't allow OO Workflow Designer to change the database schema, use this in addition to apply-upgrade(.bat) or rollback(.bat).
There are two versions of script files: with .bat suffix for Windows and with no suffix for Linux.

You can upgrade the OO Workflow Designer using the <upgrader-designer-<version>.zip> file.

You can upgrade OO Workflow Designer to the latest version using any one of the following methods:

  • Interactive mode using the command prompt as an administrator user 
  • Silent mode as an administrator user using the sample_upgrader_silent.properties file located under <installation>\upgrade\<new-version>

Upgrade OO using an interactive mode

Upgrade in Windows

  1. Navigate to the root installation path at <installation>\upgrade\<version>\bin directory. The root directory is the installation directory you chose in the installer, when you installed the earlier version of OO Workflow Designer. For example, <Installation path>\Operations Orchestration Designer.

  2. Press Shift+Right-click at the directory level and select Open the command prompt here. Make sure you have administrator privileges.

  3. At the command prompt, run the following script: apply-upgrade.bat

  4. (Optional) If required, use the following command line options:
    -h,--help: Display help on the available parameters.
    -n,--norestart: Don't restart the component after the upgrade.
  5. The upgrade process starts. 
  6. Press y when asked to apply an upgrade. The upgrade process starts and ends when an upgrade is successful.

Upgrade in Linux

  1. Navigate to <installation>/upgrade/<current_version> directory, and then run the commands: 
    chmod a+x java/linux64/bin/java
    chmod a+x -R java/linux64/lib
    This grants the Java executable and lib folder execution rights.

  2. Navigate to <installation>/upgrade/<current_version>/bin.

  3. Next, run the following command: chmod 777 apply-upgrade

    This grants the permission to read, write, and execute the file for the upgrade.

  4. To apply the upgrade, run the following script: ./apply-upgrade
  5. The upgrade process starts. 
  6. Type y when asked to apply an upgrade. The upgrade process starts and ends when an upgrade is successful.

Upgrade OO Workflow Designer in silent mode

You can upgrade OO Workflow Designer using the predefined values from the silent properties file without any manual intervention.

Before you start the upgrade in silent mode:

  1. Navigate to the extracted upgrade zip at the upgrade\<version> directory, and then edit the sample_designer_silent.properties file, using any text editor.
  2. Save the file.

Silent upgrade in Windows

  1. At the command prompt, run the following script: apply-upgrade.bat -s sample_upgrader_silent.properties
    You can use the full path of the silent properties file. For example, apply-upgrade.bat -s <designer_installation_path>/upgrade/<version>/sample_designer_silent.properties
  2. The upgrade starts and is completed without manual intervention.

Silent upgrade in Linux

  1. Navigate to the extracted upgrade zip at the <installation>/upgrade/<current_version> directory, and then run the commands: 
    chmod a+x java/linux64/bin/java
    chmod a+x -R java/linux64/lib
    This grants the Java executable and lib folder execution rights.

  2. Navigate to <installation>/upgrade/<current_version>/bin.

  3. Next, run the following command: chmod 777 apply-upgrade
    This grants the permission to read, write, and execute the file for the upgrade.

  4. To apply the upgrade, run the following script: ./apply-upgrade -s sample_designer_silent.properties
    You can use the full path of the silent properties file. For example, ./apply-upgrade -s <designer_installation_path>/upgrade/<version>/sample_designer_silent.properties
  5. The upgrade starts and is completed without manual intervention.
OpenText encourages the customer to delete the <my_designer_silent.properties>, which isn't provided by OpenText. By not deleting the properties file you may be exposing the system to increased security risks. You understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. Post upgrade tasks

Download and install drivers

Oracle drivers

Download and install the Oracle JDBC driver from the Oracle website and replace it in all locations in the installation directory. The recommended Oracle JDBC driver version is ojdbc8-12.1.0.2 to ojdbc8-19.3.0.0

Clean up after upgrade

Once the upgrade is complete:

  • You can delete the java and packages directories under <installation>/upgrade/<new-version>, but note that this will make the included scripts dysfunctional. You can always restore the scripts by extracting the upgrade zip again. 
  • You can move the backup directory (created at <installation>/upgrade/<new-version>/backup) elsewhere for archival. However, if you later wish to roll back the upgrade, you must move the backup directory back to the original location.

Review the log files post-upgrade

After an upgrade, you can find the upgrade-related log file for each upgraded component at: upgrade/<version>/upgrade.log

If the last deployment action before an upgrade was the deletion of a content pack, then it won't be possible to roll back this deletion.

For the Microsoft SQL Server database, the upgrade from version 10.02 (or older) will convert some Unicode text to the language of the database collation. As a result, text that doesn't match the collation other than English may be corrupted in the upgrade process (foreign characters will be converted to question marks). Make sure your collation is correct.

Related topics

  • For instructions to roll back an upgraded OO Workflow Designer, see Roll back an upgrade.
  • To upgrade an External OO RAS, see Upgrade an External RAS.
